glsa.title: yelp: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in yelp can lead to the execution of arbitrary code when opening a URI, for example through Firefox.

background.p: yelp is the default help browser for GNOME.

description.p: Aaron Grattafiori reported a format string vulnerability in the window_error() function in yelp-window.c.

impact.p: A remote attacker can entice a user to open specially crafted "man:" or "ghelp:" URIs in yelp, or an application using yelp such as Firefox or Evolution, and execute arbitrary code with the privileges of that user.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
